data.title: Issue March
data.meta_description: Buy Classic Pop, March - April 2024 on our Newsstand or get the subscription to the digital magazine and read it anywhere, anytime.
data.text:
86 @ClassicPopMag LISTEN NOW How many artists can say that they’ve introduced pop fans to the work of both Marvin Gaye and Joy Division within the space of the same album? Well, Paul Young’s 1983 classic No Parlez manages to do just that – and then some... It’s a remarkable record – and let’s not forget it was the second biggest-selling album of that year. Only Thriller shifted more copies in the UK. No Parlez’s producer Laurie Latham and the album’s bass player extraordinaire Pino Palladino both make similar points in our latest cover feature. When discussions turn to the most influential artists of the 80s, why is Paul Young’s name rarely in the mix? Well, we can’t account for those decade overview TV shows that overlook Paul but we’ve…

The winner of the Best Writer, Specialist category, in 2022’s British Society of Magazine Editors Awards, our latest issue sees John Earls serve up our Paul Young No Parlez cover feature, catch up with James ahead of their Yummy LP release and oversee our new albums and reissues reviews sections. Annie Zaleski is a writer and editor who’s contributed to NPR Music, Salon, Record Collector and The Guardian. She has also penned multiple books, including an extensive look at Duran Duran’s Rio for Bloomsbury’s 33 1/3 series. This issue, Annie delves into The Waterboys’ massive new boxset 1985 with Mike Scott and reviews yet another fantastic post-reunion effort from Ride. Steve O’Brien has written for such publications as The Guardian, Radio Times, The New Statesman and Empire. For Classic Pop,…

Pet Shop Boys have revealed details of their new studio album Nonetheless, which sees the duo return home to their original label Parlophone. Scheduled for release on 26 April, the 10-track Nonetheless is helmed by James Ford. It’s the first time that Neil Tennant and Chris Lowe have worked with the acclaimed producer, who has overseen albums by the likes of Arctic Monkeys, Depeche Mode, Blur and Gorillaz. Nonetheless’ lead track Loneliness was previewed on Zoe Ball’s Radio 2 show on 31 January. Recorded and mixed in the capital following sessions at Ford’s East London studio in 2023, the new album will also feature orchestral parts laid down at The Church studio. In a press statement about the LP, Pet Shop Boys said: “We wanted this album to be a…

Sophie Ellis-Bextor has reportedly signed a big money deal with major label Universal following the success of the reissued Murder On The Dancefloor. The track made No.2 on the UK Singles Chart back in 2001 upon its original release and achieved the same position earlier last month thanks to its inclusion in the final scene of recent hit movie Saltburn. The song has caused such a stir, it’s reignited interest from one of the world’s biggest record labels. A music industry source told the Mail On Sunday: “Sophie has become a global star again. Universal, her old record label, have snapped her up and she will be releasing new music later in the year. She is likely to be a bigger star than she was back in the day. It…

Soul favourite Gabrielle has released the title track of her new forthcoming studio album. Premiered during her recent 30 Years Of Dreaming Tour, which saw the singer headline the Royal Albert Hall, A Place In Your Heart, is the lead song from the upcoming LP of the same name, set for release on 10 May. The album continues Gabrielle’s creative partnership with producer and co-writer Ian Barter (Paloma Faith, Amy Winehouse) after their success with 2018’s Top 10 comeback Under My Skin and 2021’s Do It Again, which became the singer’s highest charting long-player in 20 years when it debuted at No.4 in the UK. Gabrielle will play live throughout 2024 with a gig schedule that includes dates with Chaka Khan, Tom Jones, Paloma Faith and James Arthur.…

UB40 are hitting the road this winter on a major arena tour – and Classic Pop has tickets to give away to lucky readers. The reggae legends begin their eight-date tour at the London OVO Arena Wembley on 1 November. Also on their itinerary is a hometown gig at the Resorts World Arena in Birmingham on 9 November and a trip north of the border to Glasgow’s OVO Hydro on 16 November. Further dates comprise shows in Liverpool, Cardiff, Leeds, Nottingham and Belfast. Classic Pop has four pairs of tickets to give away to readers, either seated or standing, for a venue and date of the winners’ choice. To enter the competition, simply scan the QR code above to visit the Classic Pop website.…
